humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that there are 4 positive lymph nodes out of the total 10 assessed lymph nodes (3 from the axillary lymph node dissection and 3 from the additional left axillary excision, totaling 6, and 4 out of 4 from the breast, left, total mastectomy, totaling 10). This corresponds to the N2 stage as per the AJCC staging system (New Rule 14 and New Rule 15: N2 indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has 4 positive lymph nodes (three from the left axillary lymph node dissection and one from the additional left axillary excision), which falls under the N2 category. The N2 category includes patients with 1-3 positive axillary lymph nodes or positive infraclavicular (N1c), clipped, or sentinel lymph nodes.
